intro: Sphaeralcea berteroana, commonly known as desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its glandular, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces bright yellow, four-petaled flowers that bloom in the afternoon, hence its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Sphaeralcea berteroana is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
